current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the regulation of persistent, bioaccumulative, and toxic chemical substances, and
			 for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Protecting America's Families from Toxic Chemicals Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting America's Families from Toxic Chemicals Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The purpose of this Act is to ensure that the uses of chemical substances, for which there is
			 evidence of persistence, bioaccumulation, toxicity, and exposure to humans
			 or the environment, are limited to those uses that are critical or
			 essential.
In this Act:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency

header.#text: Identification and restriction of persistent, bioaccumulative, and toxic chemical substances

text.#text: are persistent, bioaccumulative, and toxic; or

are transformed through metabolism or environmental degradation into chemical substances that are
			 persistent, bioaccumulative, and toxic; and
for which there is evidence of exposure or likely exposure to humans or the environment.

text.#text:
The following chemical substances are considered, on the basis of existing evidence, to
			 meet the criteria established under
Anthracene, pure.
Asbestos.
Cadmium and cadmium compounds.
Chloroalkanes, C10–13 (short-chain chlorinated paraffins).
p-Dichlorobenzene.
Hexabromocyclododecane, including all major diastereomers.
Hexachlorobutadiene.
Lead and lead compounds.
Mercury and mercury compounds.
Musk xylene.
Pentachlorobenzene.
Perfluorooctane sulfonic acid, its salts, and perfluorooctane sulfonyl fluoride.
Phenanthrene.
Polybrominated biphenyls.
Polybrominated diphenylethers.
Polychlorinated terphenyls.
Tetrabromobisphenol A.
1,2,3-Trichlorobenzene.
1,2,4-Trichlorobenzene.
1,2,3,4-Tetrachlorobenzene.
1,2,4,5-Tetrachlorobenzene.

text.#text: Allowable uses of chemical substances identified pursuant to

a specific use of lead or cadmium, or a compound of lead or cadmium, in lamps,
			 solder, glass, ceramics, metal alloys, plating, connectors, or electronic
			 components exempted from the Restriction on Hazardous Substances
			 Directive, Directive 2011/65/EU;

a specific use of mercury compounds in lamps in accordance with the Restriction on Hazardous
			 Substances Directive, Directive 2011/65/EU;
the use of lead or lead compounds in lead-acid batteries;	and

a specific use of perfluorooctane sulfonic acid, the salts of perfluorooctane sulfonic acid, and
			 perfluorooctane sulfonyl fluoride if the specific use is designated as 1
			 of the acceptable purposes or specific exemptions under Part III of Annex
			 B of the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants.

text.#text: The

header.#text: Criteria To identify critical or essential uses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, by order,
			 establish criteria to identify critical or essential uses of chemical
			 substances.

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall identify as critical or essential any use for which the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting America's Families from Toxic Chemicals Act of 2014/s:4/ss:d/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines—

text.#text: The criteria under
the use is in the paramount interest of national security; or

the lack of availability of the chemical substance would cause significant disruption in the
			 economy;
no feasible alternative for the specified use is available; or

the specified use provides a net benefit to public health, the environment, or public safety when
			 compared to all available alternatives, taking comparative risks into
			 account; and
the use is consistent with international legal obligations.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
